localize.title: The New York Times Trends
localize.description: See what's buzzing on The New York Times in your native language

nodes.title: The Pentagon has ordered 3,000 more troops to Poland, bringing the total number of reinforcements sent to Europe in the past two weeks to 5,000. The move will be to reassure NATO allies that the U.S. would protect them from Russian aggression. https://t.co/Y6LBqiEjTP
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Lindsey Jacobellis and Nick Baumgartner, the two oldest U.S. snowboarders in Beijing, won the first gold medal in mixed team cross. https://t.co/KU9X7UE710
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Doug Ford, the premier of Ontario, warned that protesters who did not clear transit routes could face a maximum penalty of $100,000, up to a year in prison and the potential loss of commercial and personal licenses. https://t.co/BcbXXwhHl5 https://t.co/Bc2h50sQNw
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
The koala has been declared an endangered species by the Australian government.

Drought, bush fires, disease and habitat loss have drastically reduced the numbers of the iconic marsupial. https://t.co/xqPRsylG0c https://t.co/4a6TLWMZoM
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: As protests stretch on in Canada and truckers block supply chains with the U.S., some Canadians are asking: Why hasnâ€™t Prime Minister Justin Trudeau ordered the authorities to quash the demonstrations? https://t.co/OZ72MKY8wE
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Breaking News: An Ontario court has ordered demonstrators to clear the Ambassador Bridge, a critical link at the U.S.-Canada border. https://t.co/wT610TxmNq
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: The Ukrainian Olympian Vladyslav Heraskevych ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ held up a â€œno war in Ukraineâ€ sign after his run in the menâ€™s skeleton competition on Friday. â€œItâ€™s my position, so I fight for that. I fight for peace,â€ he told the AP after the event. https://t.co/yJ6AsTM2ir
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Coronavirus booster shots lose much of their potency after about four months, raising the possibility that some people may need a fourth dose, new CDC data suggest. https://t.co/UihLT8iiUz
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Luc Montagnier, a French virologist who shared a Nobel Prize for discovering the virus that causes AIDS, has died. He was 89. https://t.co/E5f4NaieAm
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Breaking News: The Biden administration warned of an immediate threat of Russia beginning a full-scale invasion of Ukraine. https://t.co/5nQgP7j95s
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Breaking News: President Biden is moving to split $7 billion in frozen Afghan central bank assets between 9/11 victimsâ€™ families and humanitarian aid in Afghanistan. The highly unusual set of moves is expected to be announced on Friday. https://t.co/tMqWbm9oBx
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
The koala has officially been declared an endangered species by the Australian government.

Drought, bush fires, disease and habitat loss have drastically reduced the numbers of the iconic marsupial. https://t.co/L6ukFxmeF0
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Breaking News: Ayumu Hirano ğŸ‡¯ğŸ‡µ won gold for Japan in the menâ€™s snowboarding halfpipe at #Beijing2022, while Shaun White ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ finished fourth to cap his storied Olympics career. https://t.co/rsnDEQOido
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
Shaun White ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ finished his final Olympic snowboarding run, a tear in his eye, and waved to the #Beijing2022 crowd. There would be no medal. 

He fell on his second trick, got to his feet and slid slowly into the embrace of cheering fans. https://t.co/HWl5Zri0B8 https://t.co/sTQvTyHTzn
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
Nathan Chen ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ won gold at #Beijing2022 with a free skate set to an Elton John medley.

His jet-fueled jumps and a performance that raised goose bumps gave him the victory over his Japanese rivals.
https://t.co/pZrQz9BxTi
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Wolves will regain federal protection across 44 of the lower 48 states after a judge overturned a Trump-era decision that removed them from the Endangered Species List. https://t.co/asZhp5iYmR https://t.co/z2tqqtpKlB

nodes.title: Wolves will regain federal protection across 44 of the lower 48 states after a judge overturned a Trump-era decision that removed them from the Endangered Species List. https://t.co/DbYIpbhXdY

nodes.title: The National Archives and Records Administration discovered what it believed was classified information in documents Donald Trump had taken with him from the White House as he left office, according to a person briefed on the matter. https://t.co/V93byxoOFI
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
A geomagnetic storm triggered by a recent outburst of the sun destroyed up to 40 new SpaceX satellites.

They are drifting back into Earthâ€™s atmosphere, where they will burn up, potentially costing the company about $100 million.
https://t.co/3fa6R8Uj21

nodes.title: Breaking News: Jan. 6 investigators have found gaps in White House phone records during the Capitol riot, when they know Donald Trump was making calls. https://t.co/fmZsm8LVgN
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
Figure skating in the U.S. is now plainly an Asian American sport.

For the second consecutive Winter Games, four of the six figure skaters representing the U.S. in the singles events are Asian American: Karen Chen, Nathan Chen, Alysa Liu and Vincent Zhou. https://t.co/XxU7wkUxMp https://t.co/aoIznhBw2v

nodes.title:
Pierre Elliot Trudeau confronted a violent movement in Quebec in 1970 with the words, â€œJust watch me.â€

Now, some in Canada are calling for his son, Prime Minister Justin Trudeau, to channel his forcefulness as the anti-vaccine protests in Ottawa persist.
https://t.co/kNSDjT144O

Now he's made Olympic history, and he says you'll see him again in 2026. https://t.co/zyKL9J0rMD https://t.co/CpYrpx7PDD

Has it been successful? Listen to todayâ€™s episode of The Daily. https://t.co/qMrMZXJQt6

nodes.title:
Calls for anti-Muslim violence in India have reached a dangerous new pitch, human rights groups are warning.

One well-known extremist has told followers they must "be willing to die" for a Hindu state, pointing to the Taliban and ISIS as a "role model." https://t.co/0efgWSISDf

Lin-Manuel Miranda was nominated for the best original song Oscar for â€œDos Oruguitas,â€ a heart-rending ballad at the emotional climax of â€œEncanto.â€ It is the first song he had written from start to finish in Spanish.

https://t.co/oSqyLI6HVk

RenÃ© Robert, an 85-year-old photographer, died after falling on a busy street in Paris, apparently ignored for hours by passers-by. Two homeless people, all too familiar with the daily indifferences of bystanders, were the only ones to call for help.
https://t.co/63zRuhqZhl
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Afghanistan has plunged into poverty, with foreign aid frozen by sanctions on the Taliban. Nearly five million Afghans are likely to suffer severe malnutrition this year, the UN says. By one estimate, 90% of hospitals may close in the next few months. https://t.co/SU2Jn6J3dz
